phys::UI::ButtonListBox

phys::UI::ButtonListBox Class Reference

This is a widget for displaying a list of buttons in a box. More...

Detailed Description

This is a widget for displaying a list of buttons in a box.

Definition at line 60 of file uibuttonlistbox.h.

Constructor & Destructor Documentation

phys::UI::ButtonListBox::ButtonListBox ( ConstString &  name,
Vector2  Position,
Vector2  Size,
Real  ScrollbarWidth,
UI::ScrollbarStyle  ScrollStyle,
UILayer *  Layer 
)

Standard initialization constructor.

Parameters:
name The name of the Button List Box.
Position The position of the Button List Box.
Size The size of the Button List Box.
ScrollbarWidth The relative(to screensize) width of the vertical scrollbar. If a horizontal scrollbar is needed it'll use the equal value in pixels(to avoid the stretched look.
ScrollStyle The style of the scrollbar you want for this Button List Box. See Scrollbar class for more information.
Layer The parent layer this Button List Box belongs to.

Definition at line 60 of file uibuttonlistbox.cpp.

Member Function Documentation

Button * phys::UI::ButtonListBox::AddSelection ( ConstString &  name,
ConstString &  BackgroundSprite = "",
ConstString &  TextLabel = "" 
) [virtual]

Adds a selectable button to the list to be displayed.

Parameters:
BackgroundSprite Optional, name of the sprite to set as it's background. Ignored if the string is empty.
TextLabel Optional, will create a text button instead of a regular button and set it's text. Ignored if the string is empty.

Note: If a Text button is created, you can't revert it to a regular button and vice versa. You'll have to destroy the selection and make a new one. In the case of having a text button, you can however still set it's text to an empty string.
Returns:
Returns a pointer to the created button.

Checks to see if the current mouse position is over this Button List Box.

Definition at line 376 of file uibuttonlistbox.cpp.

void phys::UI::ButtonListBox::SetSelectionDistance ( const Real  Dist  )  [virtual]

Sets the distance apart(and from the sides of box) the Selections will be from each other.

This function expects a relative value to the screen size(0.0 to 1.0). This value defaults to 0.025.

Parameters:
Dist A relative value for the distance to be used when determining the positions of Selections.

void phys::UI::ButtonListBox::SetTemplateParameters ( Vector2  Size,
const Whole  Glyph 
) [virtual]

Sets the desired size and glyph set provided to all buttons created within this widget.

This function needs to be called before adding any selections to this widget.

Parameters:
Size The size for all buttons in this widget.
Glyph The Glyph set to be used for any and all Text Buttons created. Glyphs are defined in your .gorilla file.
